description:
The NEXTflex™ mtDNA-Seq Kit is designed to prepare single or paired-end DNA libraries of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) for sequencing using Illumina® platforms. The procedure isolates mitochondrial DNA from genomic DNA (gDNA) by selective digestion of linear nuclear DNA, followed by fragmentation of mtDNA and library preparation. 

Please see the full manual for additional details.

(Note: This is the procedure for Blood Samples; for Cell Samples, see this protocol.)
before_start:
Reagent Preparation
1. Briefly spin down each component to ensure material has not lodged in the cap or side of tube. Keep on ice and vortex each tube prior to use.
2. Allow Agencourt AMPure XP Beads to come to room temperature and vortex the beads until liquid appears homogenous before every use.

materials.reagent_name: 96 well Library Storage and Pooling Plate
Low melt agarose such as Low Gelling Temperature Agarose with a melt point of 65ºC

warning:
Bioo Scientific strongly recommends that you read the following warnings and precautions. Periodically, optimizations and revisions are made to the components and manual. Therefore, it is important to follow the protocol included with the kit. If you need further assistance, you may contact your local distributor or Bioo Scientific at nextgen@biooscientific.com.
• Do not use the kit past the expiration date.
• DTT in buffers may precipitate after freezing. If precipitate is seen, vortex buffer for 1-2 minutes or until the precipitate is in solution. The performance of the buffer is not affected once precipitate is in solution.
• Ensure pipettes are properly calibrated as library preparations are highly sensitive to pipetting error.
• Do not heat the DNA Adapters above room temperature.
• Try to maintain a laboratory temperature of 20°–25°C (68°–77°F).
• DNA sample quality may vary between preparations. It is the user’s responsibility to utilize high quality DNA. DNA that is heavily nicked or damaged may cause library preparation failure. Absorbance measurements at 260 nm are commonly used to quantify DNA and 260 nm / 280 nm ratios of 1.8 - 2.0 usually indicate relatively pure DNA. Other quantification methods using fluorescent dyes may also be used. The user should be aware that contaminating RNA, nucleotides and single-stranded DNA may affect the amount of usable DNA in a sample preparation.
• Vortex the genomic DNA for 10 seconds before quantification. It is critical that the user quantifies the input gDNA correctly. The yield and purity of isolated mtDNA is dependent on the concentration of gDNA used.
guidelines:
Contents, Storage and Shelf Life
The NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ mtDNA-Seq Kit contains enough material to isolate mtDNA and prepare 8 libraries for IlluminaÃÂ® compatible sequencing. The shelf life of all reagents is 12 months when stored properly. 6X Loading Dye, Nuclease-free Water, and Resuspension Buffer can be stored at room temperature. All other components should be safely stored at -20ÃÂ°C.




Required Materials Not Provided
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 2 - 8 ÃÂ¼g of genomic DNA in up to 35 ÃÂ¼L nuclease-free water
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ (Optional)NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ ChIP-Seq Barcodes Ã¢ÂÂ 6 , 12 , 24 , 48 or NEXTflex-96Ã¢ÂÂ¢ ChIP-Seq Barcodes (Cat # 514120, 514121, 514122, 514123, 514124)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Ethanol 100% (room temperature)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Covaris System (S2, E210) or other device for fragmenting DNA
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 96 well PCR Plate Non-skirted (Phenix Research, Cat # MPS-499) or similar
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 96 well Library Storage and Pooling Plate (Fisher Scientific, Cat # AB-0765) or similar
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Adhesive PCR Plate Seal (BioRad, Cat # MSB1001)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Agencourt AMPure XP 5 mL (Beckman Coulter Genomics, Cat # A63880)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Magnetic Stand-96 (Life Technologies, Cat # AM10027) or similar
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Heat block at 37ÃÂ°C and at 70ÃÂ°C
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Thermocycler
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 2, 10, 20, 200 and 1000 ÃÂ¼L pipettes, multichannel pipettes
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Nuclease-free barrier pipette tips
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Microcentrifuge
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 1.5 mL nuclease-free microcentrifuge tubes
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Low melt agarose such as Low Gelling Temperature Agarose with a melt point of 65ÃÂºC (Boston Bioproducts, Cat # P-730)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 1X TAE buffer
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ SYBR Gold (Invitrogen, Cat # S11494)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ UV transilluminator or gel documentation instrument
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Gel electrophoresis apparatus
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Electrophoresis power supply
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Vortex
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ MiVac (SpeedVac)

NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ mtDNA-Seq Flow Chart
Figure 1: Sample flow chart with approximate times necessary for each step.
Starting Material
The NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ mtDNA-Seq Kit has been optimized and validated using 2 Ã¢ÂÂ 8 ÃÂ¼g of genomic DNA isolated either from human blood or cell samples. This kit provides sufficient reagents for 8 nuclear DNA digestions and mtDNA library preparations.

It is recommended that the mtDNA isolation test (see "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest" section) is performed with each isolation. Primers and PCR master mix for this test are provided with the kit. Undigested gDNA may be used as a control (not provided).

Reagent Preparation
1. Briefly spin down each component to ensure material has not lodged in the cap or side of tube. Keep on ice and vortex each tube prior to use.
2. Allow Agencourt AMPure XP Beads to come to room temperature and vortex the beads until liquid appears homogenous before every use.

Figure 3A:ÃÂ  Bioanalyzer Gel Image



Figure 3 B: Bioanalyzer Electropherogram Image
Figure 3A & 3B: Example of a mtDNA Library Size Distribution. Upon isolation the mtDNA was sheared to 150-200 bp, a total of 18 cycles of PCR were performed. 1 ÃÂ¼L of the resulting library was run on an Agilent High Sensitivity DNA chip to verify size. Using a QubitÃÂ® 2.0 Fluorometer & QubitÃÂ® dsDNA HS Assay Kit, the concentration of the library was determined to be > 10 nM.

components.data:
For each sample, combine the following reagents on ice in nuclease-free microcentrifuge tubes:

_ μL Nuclease-free Water
_ μL gDNA (2 – 4 μg)
5 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Buffer Mix 1
5 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Buffer Mix 2
5 μL NEXTflex™ Nuclear DNA Digest Mix
50 μL TOTAL

components.data:
To ensure complete removal of nuclear DNA contamination, repeat the digestion with 35 μL eluted material from Step 18. Set up the reaction as follows.

35 μL Eluted DNA (Step 18)
5 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Buffer Mix 1
5μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Buffer Mix 2
5 μL NEXTflex™ Nuclear DNA Digest Mix
50 μL TOTAL

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 21 of NEXTflex™ mtDNA-Seq for blood samples
source_data.annotation:
If you wish to pause your experiment, the procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20 °C. To continue, thaw your frozen samples on ice before proceeding to section "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest".

Section "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest" is an optional quality control check of nuclear DNA digestion. Primers and PCR master mix for this test are provided with this kit. Performing this test with undigested gDNA as a control is highly recommended.

If not performing the section test, proceed to section "Fragmentation of mtDNA" for Fragmentation of mtDNA.
source_data.thread_text:
If you wish to pause your experiment, the procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20 °C. To continue, thaw your frozen samples on ice before proceeding to section "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest".

Section "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest" is an optional quality control check of nuclear DNA digestion. Primers and PCR master mix for this test are provided with this kit. Performing this test with undigested gDNA as a control is highly recommended.

If not performing the section test, proceed to section "Fragmentation of mtDNA" for Fragmentation of mtDNA.
source_data.body:
If you wish to pause your experiment, the procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20 °C. To continue, thaw your frozen samples on ice before proceeding to section "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest".

Section "Optional Quality Control of Nuclear DNA Digest" is an optional quality control check of nuclear DNA digestion. Primers and PCR master mix for this test are provided with this kit. Performing this test with undigested gDNA as a control is highly recommended.

If not performing the section test, proceed to section "Fragmentation of mtDNA" for Fragmentation of mtDNA.

components.data: Prepare pre-stained SYBR Gold 2% or Ethidium Bromide TAE agarose gel. Mix and pour into gel tray. Load 3 μL of the PCR product mixed with 2 μL of 6X Loading Dye and 7 μL of Nuclease-free Water. Load the samples on the gel along with 6 μL of MW 100 bp Ready-to-Load Ladder.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare pre-stained SYBR Gold 2% or Ethidium Bromide TAE agarose gel. Mix and pour into gel tray. Load 3 μL of the PCR product mixed with 2 μL of 6X Loading Dye and 7 μL of Nuclease-free Water. Load the samples on the gel along with 6 μL of MW 100 bp Ready-to-Load Ladder.

components.data: Run the gel with 1X TAE buffer at 100-120V for 60-120 minutes, or until bands have adequately resolved.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run the gel with 1X TAE buffer at 100-120V for 60-120 minutes, or until bands have adequately resolved.

components.data: Visualize the gel on UV transilluminator or gel documentation instrument. Check for the presence of a mtDNA band and absence/significant reduction (compared to the control) of nuclear DNA bands to proceed with the subsequent steps (Fig. 2 in Guidelines).
components.name: Description

components.data:
Transfer the sample to a Covaris tube. Follow manufacturer's instructions. For example, using the Covaris S2 system, the following parameters will produce fragments of 150-200 bp

Peak Intensity – 5
Duty cycle – 10%
Cycles per burst – 200
Time – 180 s
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Peak Intensity – 5
Duty cycle – 10%
Cycles per burst – 200
Time – 180 s

components.data:
Option 1: SpeedVac - following sonication, spin down sample in a SpeedVac for 2 hours
at 45°C to reduce the volume of your sample to ≤ 40 μL. Do not let the sample dry
down completely.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 33 of NEXTflex™ mtDNA-Seq for blood samples
source_data.annotation: Note that mtDNA accounts for 0.01% to 1% of total DNA and the concentration of isolated mtDNA can be very low. Concentrations typically vary between 0.1 to 1 ng/μL. It is recommended to use all of the fragmented mtDNA in library prep.
source_data.thread_text: Note that mtDNA accounts for 0.01% to 1% of total DNA and the concentration of isolated mtDNA can be very low. Concentrations typically vary between 0.1 to 1 ng/μL. It is recommended to use all of the fragmented mtDNA in library prep.
source_data.body: Note that mtDNA accounts for 0.01% to 1% of total DNA and the concentration of isolated mtDNA can be very low. Concentrations typically vary between 0.1 to 1 ng/μL. It is recommended to use all of the fragmented mtDNA in library prep.

components.data:
For each sample, combine the following reagents on ice in a nuclease-free 96 well PCR Plate:

40 μL mtDNA (from section "Fragmentation of mtDNA")
7 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA End Repair Buffer Mix
3 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA End Repair Enzyme Mix
50 μL TOTAL
components.name: Description

50 μL TOTAL

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 34 of NEXTflex™ mtDNA-Seq for blood samples
source_data.annotation:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
CLEAR CAP - NEXTflex™ mtDNA End Repair Buffer Mix, NEXTflex™ mtDNA End Repair Enzyme Mix
WHITE CAP - Nuclease-free Water

User Supplied
mtDNA in 40 μL Nuclease-free Water (from section "Fragmentation of mtDNA")
96 well PCR Plate
Adhesive PCR Plate Seal
Microcentrifuge
Ice

components.data: Incubate sample at room temperature for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate sample at room temperature for 5 minutes.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data:
Place the 96 well PCR Plate on the magnetic stand at room temperature for 5 minutes
or until the supernatant appears clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Place the 96 well PCR Plate on the magnetic stand at room temperature for 5 minutes
or until the supernatant appears clear.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove and discard clear supernatant taking care not to disturb beads. Some liquid may remain in wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove and discard clear supernatant taking care not to disturb beads. Some liquid may remain in wells.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash #1: With plate on stand, gently add 200 μL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each magnetic bead pellet and incubate plate at room temperature for 30 seconds. Carefully, remove ethanol by pipette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #1: With plate on stand, gently add 200 μL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each magnetic bead pellet and incubate plate at room temperature for 30 seconds. Carefully, remove ethanol by pipette.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash #2: With plate on stand, gently add 200 μL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each magnetic bead pellet and incubate plate at room temperature for 30 seconds. Carefully, remove ethanol by pipette. Ensure all ethanol has been removed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #2: With plate on stand, gently add 200 μL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each magnetic bead pellet and incubate plate at room temperature for 30 seconds. Carefully, remove ethanol by pipette. Ensure all ethanol has been removed.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data:
Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and let dry at room temperature for 3 minutes.
Note: Do not overdry the beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and let dry at room temperature for 3 minutes.
Note: Do not overdry the beads.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data:
Resuspend dried beads with 17 μL Resuspension Buffer. Mix well by pipetting. Ensure
beads are no longer attached to the side of the well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Resuspend dried beads with 17 μL Resuspension Buffer. Mix well by pipetting. Ensure
beads are no longer attached to the side of the well.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate resuspended beads at room temperature for 2 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate resuspended beads at room temperature for 2 minutes.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Place plate on magnetic stand for 5 minutes or until the sample appears clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place plate on magnetic stand for 5 minutes or until the sample appears clear.

components.data: Clean-Up
components.name: Section

components.data: Gently transfer 16 μL of clear sample to a new well.
components.name: Description

components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 47 of NEXTflex™ mtDNA-Seq for blood samples
source_data.annotation: If you wish to pause your experiment, the procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20°C. To restart, always thaw your frozen samples on ice before proceeding to section "3’ Adenylation".
source_data.thread_text: If you wish to pause your experiment, the procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20°C. To restart, always thaw your frozen samples on ice before proceeding to section "3’ Adenylation".
source_data.body: If you wish to pause your experiment, the procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20°C. To restart, always thaw your frozen samples on ice before proceeding to section "3’ Adenylation".

components.data:
Combine the following in the 96 well PCR Plate:

16 μL End-Repaired DNA (from section "Clean-Up")
4.5 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Adenylation Mix
20.5 μL TOTAL
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

components.data:
For each sample, combine the following reagents (in this order) in the 96-well PCR Plate:
20.5 μL 3’ Adenylated DNA (from the above section)
27.5 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Ligation Mix
2.0 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Adapter or NEXTflex™ ChIP Barcode
50 μL TOTAL
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each sample, combine the following reagents (in this order) in the 96-well PCR Plate:
20.5 μL 3’ Adenylated DNA (from the above section)
27.5 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Ligation Mix
2.0 μL NEXTflex™ mtDNA Adapter or NEXTflex™ ChIP Barcode
50 μL TOTAL

components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 51 of NEXTflex™ mtDNA-Seq for blood samples
source_data.annotation:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
PURPLE CAP - NEXTflex™ mtDNA Ligation Mix (Thaw right before use and store immediately after use at -20°C), NEXTflex™ ChIP Adapter

User Supplied
20.5 μL 3’ Adenylated DNA (from section "3’ Adenylation")
(Optional) NEXTflex™ ChIP Barcodes – 6 / 12 / 24 / 48 / 96 (Cat # 514120, 514121, 514122, 514123, 514124)
source_data.thread_text:

(Optional) NEXTflex™ ChIP Barcodes – 6 / 12 / 24 / 48 / 96 (Cat # 514120, 514121, 514122, 514123, 514124)

components.data:
For each sample, combine the following reagents on ice in the 96 well PCR plate:

36 μL Purified Ligation Product (from section "Clean-Up 2")
12 μL NEXTflex™ PCR Master Mix
2 μL NEXTflex™ Primer Mix
50 μL TOTAL

components.data: Wash #2: With plate on stand, gently add 200 μL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each sample and incubate plate at room temperature for 30 seconds. Carefully, remove ethanol by pipette. Ensure all ethanol has been removed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #2: With plate on stand, gently add 200 μL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each sample and incubate plate at room temperature for 30 seconds. Carefully, remove ethanol by pipette. Ensure all ethanol has been removed.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and let dry at room temperature for 3 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and let dry at room temperature for 3 minutes.

components.data:
Resuspend dried beads with 16 μL Resuspension Buffer. Mix well by pipetting. Ensure
beads are no longer attached to the side of the well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Resuspend dried beads with 16 μL Resuspension Buffer. Mix well by pipetting. Ensure
beads are no longer attached to the side of the well.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate resuspended beads at room temperature for 2 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate resuspended beads at room temperature for 2 minutes.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Place plate on magnetic stand for 5 minutes or until the sample appears clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place plate on magnetic stand for 5 minutes or until the sample appears clear.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Gently transfer 15 μL of clear sample to a well of a new 96 well PCR Plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently transfer 15 μL of clear sample to a well of a new 96 well PCR Plate.
